title: Far right continues to gain ground in French public opinion
subhead: France is divided, with half the population anxious about the rise of the Rassemblement National, and half enthusiastic about the solutions it claims to offer, according to an annual survey conducted by the Verian institute for Le Monde.

title: By crushing its own people, the Iranian regime paves the way for its own downfall
Trump threatens Cuba, Havana says its people are 'ready to defend the homeland'
Greenland's prime minister calls for unity in face of Washington's threats
subhead: In March 2025, Jens-Frederik Nielsen, an ex-badminton champion and Demokraatit (center-right) party head, became Greenland's youngest premier, at 34. Facing Donald Trump's threats, he has called for dialogue.

title: Californian billionaires flee potential one-off 5% wealth tax
subhead: In 2024, California had 255 billionaires, more than any other state. A state ballot initiative aimed at taxing the state's wealthiest residents could be put to a public vote in autumn 2026.

title: EU-Mercosur deal heralds real but far-off gains for the European industrial sector
subhead: Europe's automotive, chemical and machine-tool industries stand to benefit from the free trade agreement, even leading to much more gains than the potential losses in the agricultural sector.

title: Inside the Paris workshop where hats take shape
subhead: Founded in 1936 in Paris, Maison Michel continues the artisanal tradition of millinery. With the recent in-house addition of the rare skill of formiers, hat block makers, the Chanel-owned brand now oversees every step of production, enabling boundless experimentation. Determined to make hats a modern accessory, Artistic Director Priscilla Royer relishes this newfound freedom.

'The raw and brutal display of American power in the Trump II era is finally opening the eyes of Washington's allies'
subhead: Europe finds itself in a perilous phase, having recognized its solitude but lacking the means for true autonomy, while the emotion created by the aggressiveness of empires calls for a response, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: The new luxury olive oils: 'Visitors come with the same curiosity as for wine'
subhead: Olive oil has gained a new status. Championed by Michelin-starred chefs, the ingredient is now treated with the same reverence as a fine vintage wine, reflecting a precious artisanal craft. A handful of French estates are distinguishing themselves, selling their extra virgin production at premium prices.

title: The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
subhead: This region in eastern Ukraine now has only 200,000 inhabitants, compared to five million before the Russian invasion of 2022. Le Monde visited the area still under Kyiv's authority.

title: France's narrow path toward a budget
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
'Whoever controls Greenland influences a key area of European security policy'
